intro: Lycianthes neesiana, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in the morning, giving it its common name. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Lycianthes neesiana is typically grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking flowers and adaptability to various soil types.
